lines.text: Monsieur, before you continue criticizing His Majesty, I want you to know that I'm a member of the royal court.
Someday I hope to meet the thieves under more favorable circumstances. I shall teach the swine!
With all due respect for your frock, Monsignor, I think your peasants ought to be flayed for accepting help from a common thief.
Indeed, monsieur! I trust that to any gentleman of quality, he is nothing more than a blackguard.
You struck my servant! I demand an apology!
lines.character: Baron Francois de St.-Hermain, alias Roland the Bandit

lines.text: I reserve my apologies for gentlemen. Not for servants - or their peers!
Guard your tongue. You are addressing a gentleman!
Sire, I give you my word. The wench shall be taught better manners.
She is rather attractive, in a way.
Definitely - in a way!
His Majesty adores Gaston!

[laughing in embarrassment]
Table talk!
We are very proud of the boar hunting in this vicinity. The creatures are plentiful - and vicious!
I too have heard, and from an excellent source, a gentleman recently took up residence here for the boar hunting, and yet he was unable to round up a single peasant to help him enjoy the sport.
Who is this stranger?
The Baron de St.-Hermain.
De St.-Hermain? That fop! But for a miracle I would have killed him in a duel last evening!
May I ask Your Majesty what right Monsieur le Baron has to wear the uniform of the King's guard?
Not so long ago, Monsieur le Baron seemed to prefer the company of servants and barmaids!
It would be quite a romantic idea - an aristocrat who becomes a Robin Hood!
Leave this Roland to me!
You and I alone will decide the issue!
Monsieur de Montrevel, I prefer to avoid fighting.
lines.character: Baron Francois de St.-Hermain, alias Roland the Bandit

lines.text: Defend yourself!
